isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - INSTALL - CAB

svcprocinfo.para: The installation of the cab onto the chassis can be performed providing an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture are available. Installation procedures may vary for various models depending on type of equipment and accessories.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Squaring
svcsubproc.para: Cab squaring is the centering and perpendicular positioning of the cab structure to the frame. The cab must be squared whenever the cab has been removed from the chassis for repair, or if a new cab is being mounted.

The cab must be properly squared to the frame as this will affect the relationship between the cab and hood. Improper squaring may result in unacceptable appearance and interference between the cab and hood. Be sure the chassis is on a level surface before squaring.
Center cab on frame rail by measuring from inside of cab cowl to outside of frame rail on both sides, measurement should be equal on both sides, front and rear.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
Install Daycab Front Cab Mounting
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lower cab onto chassis.

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.

step1.para: Lower cab over chassis, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position front and rear cab mounting locations properly.

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are aligned properly or damage can result.

step1.para: As the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position properly the upper front cab mounting brackets (Item 7) into the lower chassis front cab mount supports (Item 4) both sides.
With cab is lowered into place, install two square head bolts (Item 3) into upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown.
Install front cab mount cap (Item 5) over two square head bolts (Item 3) under front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown.

Install two hex nuts (Item 1) and two flat washers (Item 2) onto two square head bolts (Item 3) under lower chassis front cab mount support (Item 4), driver side shown. Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side cab mounting hardware.

svcsubproc.title: Install Daycab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: The two carriage bolts (Item 9) are secured to the cab underbody sill (Item 11) with cab mount retaining clips (Item 12). The carriage bolts remain with cab underbody sill when cab is lowered into position.
Once the cab has been lowered onto the chassis and the two carriage bolts (Item 2) have been positioned properly through the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10).
Install two hex flanged nuts (Item 8) onto the two carriage bolts (Item 9) under the top plate of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10). Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on Daycab and Sleeper Cab with Cab Lifted off Chassis
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If replacing the front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown.
Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 6) into lower chassis front cab mounting support (Item 4), driver side shown.

Install hex flanged bolt (Item 14) from outside through lower chassis front cab mounting support (Item 4) and front cab mounting insulator (Item 6) and install hex flanged nut (Item 13) . Tighten to 216.8 to 239.7 Lbf-ft (294 to 325 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on Daycab and Sleeper Cab with Cab Mounted to Chassis
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If replacing the front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), use a bottle jack between bottom of cab and frame rail to support cab, driver side shown.
Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 6) into lower chassis front cab mounting support (Item 4), driver side shown.

Install hex flanged bolt (Item 14) from outside through lower chassis front cab mounting support (Item 4) and front cab mounting insulator (Item 6) and install hex flanged nut (Item 13) . Tighten to 216.8 to 239.7 Lbf-ft (294 to 325 N•m).
Install front cab mount cap (Item 5) over two square head bolts (Item 3) under front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown.

Install two hex nuts (Item 1) with two flat washers (Item 2) onto two square head bolts (Item 3) under lower chassis front cab mount support (Item 4), driver side shown. Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install Upper Front Cab Mounting Bracket for on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If replacing the upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), use a bottle jack between bottom of cab and frame rail to support cab, driver side shown.
Position upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) in place under cab, driver side shown.
Install four hex flanged bolts (Item 15) into upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Tighten to 87.7 to 106.2 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side upper front cab mounting bracket.

svcsubproc.title: Install Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts on Daycab
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the cab is lifted from the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10). Pull floor mat up to access carriage bolts in cab underbody sill (Item 11). Install two carriage bolts (Item 9) through cab floor and cab underbody sill.
With two carriage bolts (Item 9) installed through cab floor and cab underbody sill (Item 11). From underneth thread cab mount retaining clips (Item 12) onto each carriage bolt.
Position floor mat back in place and install seats as required.

Install passenger air bucket seat or fixed passenger seat, and driver air bucket seat on daycab, refer to
SEATS
. For installing passenger air bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Air Bucket Seat on Daycab. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Daycab. For installing driver air bucket seat, refer to Install Driver Air Bucket Seat on Daycab.

Install passenger air bucket seat or fixed passenger seat, and driver air bucket seat on sleeper cab, refer to
SEATS
. For installing passenger air bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Air Bucket Seat on Sleeper Cab. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Sleeper Cab. For installing driver air bucket seat, refer to Install Driver Air Bucket Seat on Sleeper Cab.
After the seats have been installed as required. Install seat belt mounting bolts securing seat belts to cab floor at the rear of the cab.

note.para: The Rear Cab Air Suspension System shown is built with the crossmember as part of the rear cab air suspension system; it is installed as an assembly at the assembly plant. Refer to (Item 10, Figure 97) .

step1.para: If it is necessary to replace any part of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10) you will have to replace each component separately as they are built into the crossmember.

note.para: The remaining steps can be performed with the aid of the appropriate service sections. Refer to the Master Service Manual for the component being installed.

step1.para: Attach exhaust system if it is the vertical type.
Attach shift lever to transmission.
Connect the following items:

item.para: Air conditioning lines (if so equipped). Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual for the proper procedures to charge air conditioning system.
Brake system (air or hydraulic). Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the Master Service Manual for bleeding instructions.

step1.para: Fill cooling system. Refer to GROUP 12 - COOLING in the Master Service Manual for the proper coolant requirements and procedures.
Connect battery ground cable.
Reattach any other connections between cab and frame, if required.
Replace or lower hood, unblock wheels, and release parking brake.
Road test vehicle. Be sure all vehicle components are operating properly before putting vehicle back into service.
